title: news.com.au — Australia’s #1 news site
text: Former Victorian Premier Jeff Kennett has accused the Coalition of “avoiding decision making” after it was revealed the Morrison government commissioned 72 reviews in the past year. “It’s been a trend now for a number of years that politicians are so scared to make decisions that they try and put out the grub work for others to do before they actually make a decision,” Mr Kennett told Sky News. Mr Kennett argued reviews not only deferred decision making, but "increased the cost of government on the community". “Leaders are elected to govern, they’re not elected to be popular,” he said. “The Australian public respect and want leadership.”
